dataClass
Class SelectedCourse

java.lang.Object
  dataClass.Course
      dataClass.SelectedCourse
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SelectedCourse>
public class SelectedCourse
extends Course
implements java.lang.Comparable<SelectedCourse>, java.io.Serializable

Author:
Niels Thykier This class is a course selected by a student. On top of all the information in the Course class, this also contains the data on which semester this course is taken.
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

SelectedCourse

public SelectedCourse(java.lang.String courseID,
                      java.lang.String courseName,
                      int semester)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a SelectedCourse from a courseID, courseName and a semester. NB: This will NOT look up all the data from the databases. Use the findCourse from Core or DatabaseReader and the SelectedCourse(Course, int) Constructor for that.

Parameters:
courseID - The ID number of the course.
courseName - The name of the Course.
semester - the semester it is taken on.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if semester is invalid (e.g. less than 1). or in case the base class Constructor would throw an exception
See Also:
Course.Course(String, String)

Method Detail

compareTo

public int compareTo(SelectedCourse compareTo)
Follows the standards of the compareTo method. This class is sorted first by the semester it appears in and secondarily the number of the course if the semesters are the same.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<SelectedCourse>
Parameters:
compareTo - the object to compare to this one.
Returns:
a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
See Also:
Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)

public static boolean isValidSemester(int semester)
